content.title: Iliac Vessel Injury
content.description: Management of iliac artery and vein injuries

key_concepts.details: High mortality (30-50%) due to massive hemorrhage and delay in diagnosis
Often associated with pelvic fractures, bowel injury, genitourinary trauma
Initial hemorrhage control; consider ligation, shunt, or temporary packing if unstable
Primary repair when possible; interposition graft; extra-anatomic bypass if contaminated

content.clinical_significance: Rapid hemorrhage control and damage control principles essential

primary_sources: Asensio JA et al. J Am Coll Surg 2003
